page.title: 17HOME LIFE 1
page.content: In a village where there is relatively little unemployment the life style of its inhabitants is as much tied to personal preferences as to finance. The exceptions are the few families with sufficient income to employ part or full time help and entertain regularly. The families of farmworkers tend to have a full mid-day meal at noon and tea in the evening. Those whose menfolk travel farther to work or who are used to so doing have a light lunch and an evening supper or dinner. Television has changed rising and bedtime habits, but older folk are generally in bed before l0 p.m. The urban retired people keep later hours as do the younger families. 7 a.m. is the normal rising time.
